alert.note: Alert for Berks; Carbon; Lehigh (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 30 at 2:34PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A line of showers with gusty winds will impact portions of central Berks, northwestern Lehigh and Carbon Counties through 345 PM EST... At 230 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a line of showers with strong gusty winds along a cold front extending from near Elysburg to near Lake Meade. Movement was east at 40 mph. This line of showers has a history of producing wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Reading, Lehighton, Wyomissing, Palmerton, Kutztown, Jim Thorpe, Hamburg, Fleetwood, Sinking Spring, Laureldale, Nesquehoning, Womelsdorf, Weatherly, Wernersville, Robesonia, Leesport, Shoemakersville, Bernville, Strausstown and Lenhartsville. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 71 and 97. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 8, and between mile markers 10 and 43. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 277 and 285. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
